p: Plant thionins are active against phytopathogenic fungi. Thus, thionins isolated from barley leaves ( Hordeum vulgare) have strong inhibition activity against Thievaliopsis paradoxa and Drechslera teres [ 35]. Another 8-Cys thionin isolated from parasitic plant Pyrilaria pubera demonstrated activity against Plectosphaerella cucumerina, Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. conglutinan, and Botrytis cinerea [ 8].
